title: Version 0.13.0-rc2 fails execution

labels.name: priority 0: blocker
labels.description: an issues that requires immediate attention and that causes the app to not work at all (e.g a crash)

body:
Tried running 0.13.0-rc2 today, noticed that the app image isn't starting.
Checked the logs, then found:

```
Warning: QQmlApplicationEngine failed to load component (:0, )

Warning: qrc:/main.qml:18:1: plugin cannot be loaded for module "StatusQ": Cannot load library /tmp/.mount_StatusNzRL1R/usr/bin/StatusQ/libStatusQ.so: (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.29' not found (required by /tmp/.mount_StatusNzRL1R/usr/bin/StatusQ/libStatusQ.so)) (qrc:/main.qml:18, )

INF 2023-06-19 09:49:15.230+02:00 starting application...                    topics="status-app" tid=255328 file=nim_status_client.nim:189

WRN 2023-06-19 09:49:15.233+02:00 Error decoding signal                      topics="signals-manager" tid=255328 file=signals_manager.nim:48 err="Unknown signal received: mediaserver.started"

Warning: Error while loading QML: QUrl("qrc:/main.qml") (:0, )

INF 2023-06-19 09:49:15.233+02:00 shutting down...                           topics="status-app" tid=255328 file=nim_status_client.nim:157

INF 2023-06-19 09:49:15.233+02:00 logging out...                             topics="app-controller" tid=255328 file=app_controller.nim:284

Traceback (most recent call last)

/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/nim_status_client.nim(193) nim_status_client

/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/nim_status_client.nim(166) mainProc

/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/app/boot/app_controller.nim(285) delete

/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/app_service/service/general/service.nim(43) logout

/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/src/backend/general.nim(27) logout

/home/jenkins/workspace/status-desktop/systems/linux/x86_64/package/vendor/nim-status-go/status_go.nim(143) logout

SIGSEGV: Illegal storage access. (Attempt to read from nil?)

Segmentation fault (core dumped)
```

According to @osmaczko 

> https://docs.appimage.org/reference/best-practices.html?highlight=glibc#binaries-compiled-on-old-enough-base-system
> As a general rule of thumb, please use no libstdc++.so.6 newer than the one that comes with the oldest distribution that you still want to support, i.e., the oldest still-supported LTS version of Ubuntu. seems this rule has been broken

- Operating System: Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS
@jakubgs please take a look

I haven't even fixed Linux builds in:

* https://github.com/status-im/infra-ci/issues/88
Also, this looks like a job for devs, if the runtime crashes.
I tought it may be related to: https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/11065/ Can it be that gcc upgrade results in glibc version upgrade as well?
For what it's worth, last week (or maybe it was the one before), I packaged the app locally using the Docker image and that build worked fine, so the issue seems in the CI or the jenkinsfile?

> For what it's worth, last week (or maybe it was the one before), I packaged the app locally using the Docker image and that build worked fine, so the issue seems in the CI or the jenkinsfile?

What version of Ubuntu are you on?
Ubuntu 20.04.3 LTS

> For what it's worth, last week (or maybe it was the one before), I packaged the app locally using the Docker image and that build worked fine, so the issue seems in the CI or the jenkinsfile?

The GCC update landed 5 days ago. Could you please retry with current master?

Our Docker image for Linux builds is still on `18.04` due to Glibc limitation:
https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/blob/54ae6a31546b75d36e6f21447a5f6a1af124e922/ci/Dockerfile#L4

That has not changed in more than 2 years.

I doubt it's the GCC upgrade, as we've been using GCC 11 for E2E linux builds for a long while without any issues.

But one check we could do is see if this build also crashes: [`StatusIm-Desktop-230614-093117-38d3b3-pr11065-x86_64.tar.gz`](https://status-im-desktop-prs.ams3.cdn.digitaloceanspaces.com/StatusIm-Desktop-230614-093117-38d3b3-pr11065-x86_64.tar.gz)

* https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/11065
Latest master worked fine when packaged using `build-linux.sh` on my machine.

Welp, not the greatest test actually, because I tried `0.13.0.rc2` and it actually works on my machine...

I doubt the Ubuntu version difference between Pascal and I is the difference
I have checked the PR linux build from https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/11065 and it works fine on my machine.

But I have also tried the [`0.13.0-rc.2`](https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/releases/tag/untagged-2e2e1217d2853d4221e7) AppImage and it worked as well. So that doesn't tell us much.

@0x-r4bbit does the build from https://github.com/status-im/status-desktop/pull/11065 also explode like that for you?

@jakubgs unfortunately it does not work either.

Same issue as described in the original issue:

```
Warning: QQmlApplicationEngine failed to load component (:0, )
Warning: qrc:/main.qml:18:1: plugin cannot be loaded for module "StatusQ": Cannot load library /tmp/.mount_StatusewN8e2/usr/bin/StatusQ/libStatusQ.so: (/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libstdc++.so.6: version `GLIBCXX_3.4.29' not found (required by /tmp/.mount_StatusewN8e2/usr/bin/StatusQ/libStatusQ.so)) (qrc:/main.qml:18, )
INF 2023-06-20 08:45:34.766+02:00 starting application...                    topics="status-app" tid=532046 file=nim_status_client.nim:189
WRN 2023-06-20 08:45:34.769+02:00 Error decoding signal                      topics="signals-manager" tid=532046 file=signals_manager.nim:48 err="Unknown signal received: mediaserver.started"
Warning: Error while loading QML: QUrl("qrc:/main.qml") (:0, )
INF 2023-06-20 08:45:34.769+02:00 shutting down...                           topics="status-app" tid=532046 file=nim_status_client.nim:157
INF 2023-06-20 08:45:34.769+02:00 logging out...                             topics="app-controller" tid=532046 file=app_controller.nim:284
Traceback (most recent call last)
```
@jakubgs That one works!
Makes no sense - since we use GCC 11 for e2e builds - but okay. Will you review it?

@0x-r4bbit can you also test the new `master` build?
https://ci.infra.status.im/job/status-desktop/job/master/2547/
@jakubgs that one works for me as well.
